page.title: 16AIDEES POTTERY BOVEY TRACEY
page.content: {Aidees}is a large{Perfume Factory.}It has its own{Pottery}to make{dishes}and {pommanders.}They use a plastic clay. They make the clay into{Blunge}which is the clay mixed with water and added chemicals. Then they pour the clay into plaster moulds and it is left there to dry. It is then{fettled}which means the seams are removed using a knife. It is then sponged off. The pottery is then{bisque fired}which is the first firing done to the shaped clay. Then it is{glazed}which involves dipping the bisqueware in finely ground glass mixed with water and stains. Then they overspray which is generally a contrasting colour. The pottery is then{glost fired}to produce the finished items. The pottery is then checked for flaws and graded firsts seconds and rejects.
